medium_description_en: Defines the management of traumatic brain injury.
instructions_en: Use in traumatic brain injury patients with intracranial hemorrhage, Glasgow Coma Score 13-15, and no focal neurologic or pupillary findings.

seo.meta_description_en: The Modified Brain Injury Guideline (mBIG) defines the management of traumatic brain injury.
seo.keywords_en: Modified Brain Injury Guideline (BIG), Brain Injury Guideline (BIG), mbig, big, brain, brain injury, brain trauma, trauma, traumatic brain injury, injury guideline, traumatic brain injury guideline, brain injury management

how_to_use.use_case_en: Traumatic brain injury patients with intracranial hemorrhage, Glasgow Coma Score 13-15, and no focal neurologic or pupillary findings.

next_steps.advice_en: Do you use the Modified Brain Injury Guideline (mBIG) and want to contribute your expertise? Join our contributor team!

about.formula_en: EDH: epidural hematoma, EtOH: blood alcohol level, GCS: Glasgow Coma Score, ICH: intracranial hemorrhage, IPH: intraparenchymal hemorrhage, IVH: intraventricular hemorrhage, SAH: subarachnoid hemorrhage, SDH: subdural hematoma, TBI: traumatic brain injury

Validation.text: Khan AD, Elseth AJ, Brosius JA, et al. Multicenter assessment of the Brain Injury Guidelines and a proposal of guideline modifications. Trauma Surg Acute Care Open. 2020;5(1):e000483.
Azim A, Jehan FS, Rhee P, et al. Big for small: Validating brain injury guidelines in pediatric traumatic brain injury. J Trauma Acute Care Surg. 2017;83(6):1200-1204.

Joseph B, Aziz H, Pandit V, et al. Prospective validation of the brain injury guidelines: managing traumatic brain injury without neurosurgical consultation. J Trauma Acute Care Surg. 2014;77(6):984-988.
Khan AD, Lee J, Galicia K, et al. A multicenter validation of the modified brain injury guidelines: Are they safe and effective? J Trauma Acute Care Surg. 2022;93(1):106-112.

Original/Primary Reference.text: Khan AD, Elseth AJ, Brosius JA, et al. Multicenter assessment of the Brain Injury Guidelines and a proposal of guideline modifications. Trauma Surg Acute Care Open. 2020;5(1):e000483.

Other References.text: Joseph B, Friese RS, Sadoun M, et al. The BIG (Brain injury guidelines) project: defining the management of traumatic brain injury by acute care surgeons. J Trauma Acute Care Surg. 2014;76(4):965-969.

creator_info.about_en: Abid D. Khan, MD, is a general surgeon and intensive care medicine doctor in Colorado Springs, Colorado. He is a participant in the Medicare Physician Quality Reporting System (PQRS) Incentive Program and is committed to heart health through the Million Hearts initiative. Dr. Khan’s primary research is focused on trauma and critical care.
